data.title: Ellis County PUMA, TX
data.meta_description: In 2022, Ellis County PUMA, TX had a population of 196k people with a median age of 36.2 and a median household income of $93,248. Between 2021 and 2022 the population of Ellis County PUMA, TX grew from 187,777 to 195,509, a 4.12% increase and its median household income grew from $85,218 to $93,248, a 9.42% increase.
data.text:
In 2022, Ellis County PUMA, TX had a population of 196k people with a median age of 36.2 and a median household income of $93,248. Between 2021 and 2022 the population of Ellis County PUMA, TX grew from 187,777 to 195,509, a 4.12% increase and its median household income grew from $85,218 to $93,248, a 9.42% increase.

18.9% of the households in Ellis County PUMA, TX reported speaking a non-English language at home as their primary shared language. This does not consider the potential multi-lingual nature of households, but only the primary self-reported language spoken by all members of the household.

Most people in Ellis County PUMA, TX drove alone to work, and the average commute time was 30.6 minutes. The average car ownership in Ellis County PUMA, TX was 2 cars per household.

Ellis County PUMA, TX is home to a population of 196k people, from which 95.3% are citizens. As of 2022, 7.71% of Ellis County PUMA, TX residents were born outside of the country (15.1k people).

In 2022, there were 4.28 times more White (Non-Hispanic) residents (110k people) in Ellis County PUMA, TX than any other race or ethnicity. There were 25.7k White (Hispanic) and 24.4k Black or African American (Non-Hispanic) residents, the second and third most common ethnic groups.

The most common non-English languages spoken as the primary langauge in households in Ellis County PUMA, TX are Spanish (31,785 households), Arabic (487 households), and Swahili or Other Languages of Central, Eastern, & Southern Africa (219 households).

As of 2022, 95.3% of Ellis County PUMA, TX residents were US citizens, which is higher than the national average of 93.5%. In 2021, the percentage of US citizens in Ellis County PUMA, TX was 95.5%, meaning that the rate of citizenship has been decreasing.

The following chart shows US citizenship percentages in Ellis County PUMA, TX compared to that of it's neighboring and parent geographies.

In 2022, there were 4.28 times more White (Non-Hispanic) residents (110k people) in Ellis County PUMA, TX than any other race or ethnicity. There were 25.7k White (Hispanic) and 24.4k Black or African American (Non-Hispanic) residents, the second and third most common ethnic groups.

27.5% of the people in Ellis County PUMA, TX are hispanic (53.8k people).

The following chart shows the 7 races represented in Ellis County PUMA, TX as a share of the total population.

As of 2022, 7.71% of Ellis County PUMA, TX residents (15.1k people) were born outside of the United States, which is lower than the national average of 13.6%. In 2021, the percentage of foreign-born citizens in Ellis County PUMA, TX was 7.8%, meaning that the rate has been decreasing.

The following chart shows the percentage of foreign-born residents in Ellis County PUMA, TX compared to that of it's neighboring and parent geographies.

18.9% of the households in Ellis County PUMA, TX reported speaking a non-English language at home as their primary shared language, which is lower than the national average of 21.7%. This does not consider the potential multi-lingual nature of households, but only the primary self-reported language spoken by all members of the household.

In 2022, the most common non-English language spoken in households in Ellis County PUMA, TX was Spanish. 17.4% of the households in Ellis County PUMA, TX reported speaking Spanish at home as the primary shared language between all members living in the household.

The economy of Ellis County PUMA, TX employs 92.9k people. The largest industries in Ellis County PUMA, TX are Elementary & secondary schools (8,649 people), Construction (8,326 people), and Restaurants & Food Services (4,924 people), and the highest paying industries are Hardware, & plumbing & heating equipment, & supplies merchant wholesalers ($188,519), Miscellaneous manufacturing, n.e.c. ($132,811), and Petroleum & petroleum products merchant wholesalers ($127,577).

Males in Ellis County PUMA, TX have an average income that is 1.3 times higher than the average income of females, which is $58,303. The income inequality in Ellis County PUMA, TX (measured using the Gini index) is 0.413, which is lower than than the national average.

The workforce of Ellis County PUMA, TX in 2020 was 84,360 people, with 46.5% woman, and 53.5% men.

The visualization shows the distribution of the workforce by gender and age in Ellis County PUMA, TX.

With the upper buttons you can see the distribution of the average salary and add a filter by race.

From 2021 to 2022, employment in Ellis County PUMA, TX grew at a rate of 5%, from 88.5k employees to 92.9k employees.

The most common job groups, by number of people living in Ellis County PUMA, TX, are Other managers (3,240 people), Driver/sales workers & truck drivers (2,791 people), and Elementary & middle school teachers (2,604 people). This chart illustrates the share breakdown of the primary jobs held by residents of Ellis County PUMA, TX.

From 2021 to 2022, employment in Ellis County PUMA, TX grew at a rate of 5%, from 88.5k employees to 92.9k employees.

The most common employment sectors for those who live in Ellis County PUMA, TX, are Elementary & secondary schools (8,649 people), Construction (8,326 people), and Restaurants & Food Services (4,924 people). This chart shows the share breakdown of the primary industries for residents of Ellis County PUMA, TX, though some of these residents may live in Ellis County PUMA, TX and work somewhere else. Census data is tagged to a residential address, not a work address.

As of February 2023, there are 13.8M people employed in Texas. This represents a 4.59% increase in employment when compared to February 2022.

Right after the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic, during April 2020, a general dip can be seen across industry sectors, resulting in an overall decline in employment by 9.63%.

The following chart shows monthly employment numbers for each industry sector in Texas.

In the 2020 presidential election, the popular vote in Texas went to Donald J. Trump with 52.1% of the vote. The runner-up was Joseph R Biden Jr. (46.5%), followed by Jo Jorgensen (1.12%).

John Cornyn and Ted Cruz are the senators currently representing the state of Texas. In the United States, senators are elected to 6-year terms with the terms for individual senators staggered.

Texas is currently represented by 38 members in the U.S. house, and members of the House of Representives are elected to 2-year terms.

In 2022, universities in Ellis County PUMA, TX awarded 557 degrees. The student population of Ellis County PUMA, TX in 2022 is skewed towards women, with 869 male students and 925 female students.

Most students graduating from Universities in Ellis County PUMA, TX are White (335 and 60.9%), followed by Hispanic or Latino (113 and 20.5%), Black or African American (49 and 8.91%), and Two or More Races (21 and 3.82%).

The largest universities in Ellis County PUMA, TX by number of degrees awarded are Southwestern Assemblies of God University (557 and 100%).

The most popular majors in Ellis County PUMA, TX are Christian Studies (94 and 16.9%), Biblical Studies (75 and 13.5%), and Other Pastoral Counseling & Specialized Ministries (59 and 10.6%).

The median tuition cost in Ellis County PUMA, TX for private four year colleges is $16,822.

In 2022 in Ellis County PUMA, TX, the percentage of applicants admitted was 85.6%, while the percentage of admitted who enrolled was 55.9%. The number of students enrolled in 2022 was 1,794 (48.4% men and 51.6% women).

The line chart shows the evolution of the percentage of applicants admitted, admitted who enrolled or the number of students enrolled according to the option selected in the upper button.

In 2022, 245 men were awarded degrees from institutions in Ellis County PUMA, TX, which is 0.785 times less than the 312 female students who received degrees in the same year.

In 2022 the most common race/ethnicity group awarded degrees at institutions was White students. These 335 degrees mean that there were 2.96 times more degrees awarded to White students then the next closest race/ethnicity group, Hispanic or Latino, with 113 degrees awarded.

Private not-for-profit, 4-year or above ($16,822) is the sector with the highest median state tuition in 2022.

Private not-for-profit, 4-year or above ($960) is the sector with the highest median state fee in 2022.

Private not-for-profit, 4-year or above ($1,338) is the sector with the highest average net price of books and supplies.

The graph shows the average net price by sector and year.

The median property value in Ellis County PUMA, TX was $275,800 in 2022, which is 0.978 times smaller than the national average of $281,900. Between 2021 and 2022 the median property value increased from $239,000 to $275,800, a 15.4% increase. The homeownership rate in Ellis County PUMA, TX is 75.9%, which is approximately the same as the national average of 64.8%.

People in Ellis County PUMA, TX have an average commute time of 30.6 minutes, and they drove alone to work. Car ownership in Ellis County PUMA, TX is approximately the same as the national average, with an average of 2 cars per household.

Median household income in Ellis County PUMA, TX is $93,248. In 2022, the PUMA with the highest Median Household Income in Ellis County PUMA, TX was Fort Bend County (Northwest) PUMA, TX with a value of $159,431, followed by Denton County (South Central)--Flower Mound Town & Highland Village City PUMA, TX and Collin County (Northwest)--Celina City & Prosper Town PUMA, TX, with respective values of $157,973 and $153,785.

In 2022, the median household income of the 65.7k households in Ellis County PUMA, TX grew to $93,248 from the previous year's value of $85,218.

The following chart displays the households in Ellis County PUMA, TX distributed between a series of income buckets compared to the national averages for each bucket. The largest share of households have an income in the $75k - $100k range.

In 2022, the income inequality in Ellis County PUMA, TX was 0.413 according to the GINI calculation of the wage distribution. Income inequality had a 1.72% decline from 2021 to 2022, which means that wage distribution grew somewhat more even. The GINI for Ellis County PUMA, TX was lower than than the national average of 0.478. In other words, wages are distributed more evenly in Ellis County PUMA, TX in comparison to the national average.

This chart shows the number of workers in Ellis County PUMA, TX across various wage buckets compared to the national average.

In 2022, 79.6% of workers in Ellis County PUMA, TX drove alone to work, followed by those who carpooled to work (9.57%) and those who worked at home (9.22%).

The following chart shows the number of households using each mode of transportation over time, using a logarithmic scale on the y-axis to help better show variations in the smaller means of commuting.

Using averages, employees in Ellis County PUMA, TX have a longer commute time (30.6 minutes) than the normal US worker (26.7 minutes). Additionally, 3.45% of the workforce in Ellis County PUMA, TX have "super commutes" in excess of 90 minutes.

The chart below shows how the median household income in Ellis County PUMA, TX compares to that of it's neighboring and parent geographies.

8.2% of the population for whom poverty status is determined in Ellis County PUMA, TX (15.9k out of 193k people) live below the poverty line, a number that is lower than the national average of 12.5%. The largest demographic living in poverty are Females 25 - 34, followed by Males 6 - 11 and then Females 35 - 44.

The most common racial or ethnic group living below the poverty line in Ellis County PUMA, TX is White, followed by Hispanic and Black.

The Census Bureau uses a set of money income thresholds that vary by family size and composition to determine who classifies as impoverished. If a family's total income is less than the family's threshold than that family and every individual in it is considered to be living in poverty.

83.9% of the population of Ellis County PUMA, TX has health coverage, with 53.5% on employee plans, 9.43% on Medicaid, 10.1% on Medicare, 9.36% on non-group plans, and 1.49% on military or VA plans.

Primary care physicians in Texas see 1641 patients per year on average, which represents a 0.737% increase from the previous year (1629 patients). Compare this to dentists who see 1607 patients per year, and mental health providers who see 691 patients per year.

Primary care physicians in Texas see an average of 1,641 patients per year. This represents a 0.737% increase from the previous year (1,629 patients).

The following chart shows how the number of patients seen by primary care physicians has been changing over time in Texas in comparison to its neighboring geographies.

In 2022, insured persons according to age ranges were distributed in 28% under 18 years, 20.5% between 18 and 34 years, 38.8% between 35 and 64 years, and 12.7% over 64 years.

By gender, of the total number of insured persons, 49.4% were men and 50.6% were women.

The following chart shows the number of people with health coverage by gender.
